newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- April 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page- April 4.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Friday:
* Israel withdrew its request to extradite a Palestinian militant organisation leader who has been in jail in New York for the past 21 months.
* Congessional investigators have learned that drug smuggler Jorge Cabrera was asked for a campaign contribution in Cuba by a prominent Democratic fund-raiser.
* President Clinton said two senior Administration officials who tried to help Webster Hubbell find a job after he resigned from the Justice Department acted out of compassion.
* Swiss prosecutors have found drug traffickers paid the brother of Mexico's former president millions of dollars to protect drug shipments. Swiss authorities are getting ready to sieze the money.
* New York's public hospital system has emerged financially stronger from three years of budget cuts, city officials say.
* Hundreds of America Online subscribers have complained about unexpected charges related to using an "800" number to gain access to the service.
* Advertisers plan to wrap billboards around New York's distinctive wooden water towers which sit atop buildings.
